intro: Chaenorhinum gerense, commonly known as the yellow evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers have five petals with a distinctive yellow color. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is often found in coastal regions.
